abstract.text: A memory fence to capture, track, and manage resource dependencies across command encoders.

inlineContent.text: instance is typically used to track a resource created from an
instance. You can also track non-heap resources that have tracking mode
instance. A command encoder can either update a fence or wait for a fence.
When using a fence across multiple
instances, commit the queue that updates a fence before committing the queue that waits on a fence. Consider using an
instead of a fence for these situations.
Methods that wait for a fence

abstract.text: Render advanced 3D graphics and compute data in parallel with graphics processors.
An object for encoding commands that build or refit acceleration structures.
Encodes a command that instructs the GPU to update a fence, which signals passes waiting on the fence.
Encodes a command that instructs the GPU to pause before starting the acceleration structure commands until another pass updates a fence.
Describes the types of resources that a barrier operates on.
An interface you can use to encode GPU commands that copy and modify the underlying memory of various Metal resources.
Encodes a command that instructs the GPU to update a fence, which signals passes waiting on the fence.
Encodes a command that instructs the GPU to wait until a pass updates a fence.
An instance you use to create, submit, and schedule command buffers to a specific GPU device to run the commands within those buffers.
An interface for dispatching commands to encode in a compute pass.
Encodes a command that instructs the GPU to update a fence, allowing passes waiting on the fence to start or resume.
Encodes a command that instructs the GPU to pause pass execution until a fence updates.
The main Metal interface to a GPU that apps use to draw graphics and run computations in parallel.
Creates a new memory fence instance.
A simple semaphore to synchronize access to Metal resources.
A memory fence to capture, track, and manage resource dependencies across command encoders.
The device object that created the fence.
A string that identifies the fence.
A memory pool from which you can suballocate resources.
An interface that encodes a render pass into a command buffer, including all its draw calls and configuration.
Encodes a command that instructs the GPU to update a fence after one or more stages, which signals passes waiting on the fence.
Encodes a command that instructs the GPU to pause before starting one or more stages of the render pass until a pass updates a fence.
The stages in a render pass that triggers a synchronization command.
An option specifying that the app must prevent hazards when modifying this objectâ€™s contents.
An encoder that encodes commands that modify resource configurations.
Encodes a command that instructs the GPU to update a fence, which signals passes waiting on the fence.
Encodes a command that instructs the GPU to pause before starting the resource state commands until another pass updates a fence.
Use fences to synchronize access to resources allocated on a heap.

abstract.text: Optimize resource performance within an argument buffer.

abstract.text: The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
